Description: Shoulder and neck sherd of Western Nile Delta pottery closed vessel, probably an oinochoe (or an amphora); very worn pale slip; exterior: at junction of neck and shoulder, horizontal incised line; below, part of incised tongue frieze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The vessel is likely to have been produced by Greek potters at Naukratis, see Schlotzhauer 2012, cat no. NAU 155.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 182, Nau 155, pl. 34h)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IA.07)
